TEI.2.document_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1922: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1928), 3 vols., Vol 2, pp. 81
TEI.2.document_title: Stephen F Austin to The Governor, 07-29-1828

barker_notes.barker_summary: Austin to Governor of Coahuila and Texas, July 29, 1828. Accepting and interpreting contract to settle a colony on the coast. (Omitted.)
barker_notes.barker_footnotes: From Translation of Empresario Contracts, p. 155, General Land Office of Texas. For discussion of the provisions of this contract see Padilla to Austin, July 12, 1828.
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 81

text.body:
*div1 type="summary"* *p*Austin to Governor of Coahuila and Texas, July 29, 1828. Accepting and interpreting contract to settle a colony on the coast. (Omitted.)*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*San Felipe,*/location_mentioned* *date_mentioned n="07-29-1828">July 29, 1828*/date_mentioned*.*/p* *p*See Calendar.*/p*
*/div1*
